definition: to stretch taut
to draw tight/to stretch taut/to tack (with thread or pin)/embroidery hoop/woven bed mat
to have a taut face
tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten

sentences.english: Feel the body relax, feel the tenseness disappear, but do not fall asleep.
sentences.chinese: 感覺身體放鬆，感覺繃緊消失，但是不要睡着。

sentences.english: He was like a taut string; you can play the notes from time to time.
sentences.chinese: 他像是一根繃緊的弦，時不時可以彈奏出音符。

sentences.english: I wear glasses and I've found that I have tension in my ears to hold my glasses in place.
sentences.chinese: 我耳朵處肌肉就繃緊了，否則它們架不住我的眼鏡。

sentences.english: Investors have largely held their nerve.
sentences.chinese: 投資者們都繃緊着神經。

sentences.english: Your canvas should now be taut and smooth.
sentences.chinese: 你的帆布包，現在應該繃緊和平穩。

sentences.english: "What do you do?"Distance Anne Ya Beng Jin nerve.
sentences.chinese: “你做什麼？”程安雅繃緊了神經。

sentences.english: He tightened up the rope a little.
Her nipples were clearly outlined-where they pressed against the cotton T-shirt.
sentences.chinese: 她的圓領衫繃緊處兩個奶頭輪廓鮮明。

sentences.english: I hadn't slept all night. My neck and back were like coiled 7 springs, and my eyes stung 8.
sentences.chinese: 我徹夜未眠，脖子和後背像繃緊的鋼絲，眼睛刺痛。

sentences.english: He tensed his muscles for the leap.
In the beginning we thought that on the wrong car, and like clockwork, like the heart of the tension.
sentences.chinese: 一開始我們以爲上錯車了，心像發條一樣繃緊了。

sentences.english: He used to walk on a tight-rope across the Niagara Falls.
sentences.chinese: 他走在一條繃緊的繩子上橫穿尼亞加拉大瀑布。

sentences.english: Don't pop out contact lenses but just tense them.
sentences.chinese: 別隱形眼鏡瞪出來，只是繃緊他們。

sentences.english: The ropes quivered tautly under his hands.
sentences.chinese: 他兩手間繃緊的繩索微微抖動。

sentences.english: You suffer from muscle fatigue and tension after exercise.
sentences.chinese: 你在運動後感到肌肉疲勞及肌肉繃緊。

sentences.english: Celiac skin take up, bosomy sky is empty person, empty also.
sentences.chinese: 腹皮繃緊，鼓之空空者，虛也。

definition: to stretch taut/(of muscles etc) taut/strained/tense
to release/to let go/to loosen/to untie/to come loose
strong/sturdy/robust
legs/both legs/two legs
to concentrate one's attention completely (idiom)/with rapt attention
calm/unruffled
tight knot/intractable problem
to tremble
hand and foot/movement of limbs/action/trick/step in a procedure (CL: 道[dao4])
arms/both arms/two arms
to be unable to breathe
lit. to bite the teeth tightly (idiom); fig. to grit one's teeth and bear the pain/to bite the bullet
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
to tremble
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
to be unable to move a single step
